title: Album Page, "Sketches of 4th Window, Second Story, Possibly at Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on very smooth, thin off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, at top: 4th window, second story.  Various inscriptions throughout with dimensions and measurements.  Verso, in graphite, upper right corner: 97.
dimensions: Sheet: 30.6 x 19.4 cm (12 1/16 x 7 5/8 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet tipped into binding depicting on three separate sketches: above is an elevation of a window bay with points 'AB' and 'CD' noted; in the center is a plan of the central column and arches referred to in the window above; at the bottom of the sheet are two plans of the from the same window in the upper sketch, but rendered from the two separate coordinates 'AB' and 'CD' referenced in the top sketch.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of 4th Window, Second Story, Possibly at Abbey of Chiaravalle, Milan", late 19th century.Graphite on very smooth, thin off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-258.
